page.title: 11A lifetime of Change
page.content: Mr. Green is our headteacher. He has lived in Sharlston on and off for 37 years. Mr. Green first went to Sharlston School (that is the school I go to). He later passed a test and went to grammar school. We asked Mr. Green if the school had changed much. He said that the age range had changed because then children started at 5 and left at 14. Also children did more work from the blackboard and always sat in rows. Like many boys, he had very short hair with a long fringe at the front.Boys wore short trousers and sometimes clothes handed down from older children. He thought children were more confident today. The only thing he would bring back from the past was the countryside.
